main event: Multiple unidentified flying object sightings reported in Dayton, Ohio, in August 1963, with various conclusions drawn about their nature, including potential reflections of stars and the satellite Pegasus I.
interesting points: There were several reports of sightings in August 1963 lasting between 2-10 minutes., Observers described the objects as bright lights that moved erratically and sometimes appeared to disappear and reappear., The presumed objects were thought to be Venus, Spica or satellites instead of actual UFOs., Witnesses reported that one object was distinctively red while others were identified as white., No photographs or physical evidence were documented for these sightings.
sighted object: Bright lights, potentially satellites or reflections
witness description: Multiple civilian witnesses reported the sightings.
